com.redhat.rhn.common.security

Class HMAC

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.common.security.HMAC

  • public class HMAC
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to generate Hashed Message Authentication Codes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String byteArrayToHex(byte[] a)
      Convert a byte array to a hex string of the format "1f 30 b7".
      static java.lang.String md5(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String key)
      Generate an HMAC hash for the given text and key using MD5 as the hash function.
      static java.lang.String sha1(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String key)
      Generate an HMAC hash for the given text and key using SHA1 as the hash function.

    • Method Detail

      • byteArrayToHex

        public static java.lang.String byteArrayToHex(byte[] a)
        Convert a byte array to a hex string of the format "1f 30 b7". package protected so that SessionSwap can use it.
        Parameters:
        a - The byte array to convert
        Returns:
        the resulting hex string

      • sha1

        public static java.lang.String sha1(java.lang.String text,
                                    java.lang.String key)
        Generate an HMAC hash for the given text and key using SHA1 as the hash function.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to hash
        key - The key to use when generating the hash.
        Returns:
        The resulting hash string

      • md5

        Generate an HMAC hash for the given text and key using MD5 as the hash function.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to hash
        key - The key to use when generating the hash.
        Returns:
        The resulting hash string TODO: Make this use the JDK MD5 algorithm as above vs the custom one below.
